description: Dive into "Whispers of Love in Zermatt" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Whispers of Love in Zermatt

places.generalDescription: Matterhorn Glacier Paradise is a must-visit destination in the Alps, offering a breathtaking experience. The journey to this highest cable car station in Europe from Zermatt village takes 45 minutes, providing panoramic views of peaks and glaciers. At the top station, visitors can explore a restaurant, shop, cinema, and viewing platform showcasing famous Alpine peaks in France, Italy, and Switzerland.

sources.snippet: If you want a sneak peek of paradise, visit the Matterhorn Glacier Paradise, where Europe‚Äôs highest cable car station is located. Once you reach the 3,883-meter high station, you‚Äôll have a fantastic view of the Alps and eat some delicious food (yes, there‚Äôs a restaurant up there). While up at the Glacier, besides wondering how they bring the ingredients all the way up to the restaurant, you‚Äôll think about living the rest of your life looking at peaks and snowy mountains.
sources.shortName: 21 Best Attractions and Things to Do in Zermatt, Switzerland

sources.snippet: But theres a few things I loved about Zermatt in summer that were totally free. They included walking the village streets which are absolutely charming and laden with flowers everywhere is a ‚Äòmust-do‚Äô. The swiss cheese shops were irresistible and I will confess to buying a few hunks of cheese and consuming it back in my room on the balcony while gazing at the Matterhorn.
sources.shortName: Falling in love with the beautiful Swiss village of Zermatt

sources.snippet: Explore the car-free village, enjoy the day excursions to Gornegrat and Matterhorn Glacier Paradise, immerse yourself in breathtaking sightseeing, and uncover essential tips for an unforgettable trip. Learn from the mistakes I made* for a flawless trip. Let Zermatt weave its magic and create lasting memories in this captivating Swiss village.*
sources.shortName: Zermatt Travel Guide: From Hating to Falling in Love with the Majestic Matterhorn

sources.snippet: Normally, this is the way up to the top for skiiers and snowboarders. However, it‚Äôs also available for those who are just keen for a visit to the top of the mountain ‚Äì me again!. You can take the gondola rides all the way to the top to enjoy the views.
sources.shortName: 15 things you must do in Zermatt, Switzerland

sources.snippet: There are three main mountain peaks to visit from Zermatt: Matterhorn Glacier Paradise, Gornergrat, and Rothorn. Visit all three or pick your favorite. We cover all of these later in this article.
sources.shortName: 20 Amazing Things to Do in Zermatt, Switzerland
Most Romantic Things to Do in Zermatt

places.name: Matterhorn Glacier Paradise

reviews.text:
Visiting Matterhorn Glacier Paradise was one of the most unforgettable highlights of my time in Switzerland, as well as in Zermatt. The journey up, via a series of gondolas, builds anticipation with every stop, and once you reach the top, the panoramic views are absolutely breathtaking. Standing at over 12,700 feet, with snow-covered peaks stretching across Switzerland, France, and Italy, it truly feels like you're on top of the world.

One of the most unique features is the Ice Palace, an ethereal experience where you walk inside a glacier. The cool, quiet tunnels carved into the ice are unlike anything I've seen before, with sculptures and shimmering walls that make the whole experience feel dreamlike.

The combination of the Ice Palace, the observation deck, and the surreal stillness at that altitude created a moment of awe I wasn't expecting. It's more than just a viewpoint; it's a space that invites you to pause, breathe deeply, and feel small in the best possible way. Despite the high elevation, the facilities were incredibly well maintained, and everything felt thoughtfully designed for visitors.

For anyone visiting Zermatt, this isn't just a scenic stop, it's a once-in-a-lifetime experience that stays with you long after you descend.

Matterhorn Glacier Paradise was absolutely amazing. Easy gondola ride up from town, and the views at the top are insane. You're surrounded by glaciers and massive peaks, and you can even spot mountaineers and skiers out on the snowfields. We hiked the Matterhorn Glacier Trail partway down, and the scenery was nonstop. Alpine lakes, rocky terrain, and the Matterhorn in the background the whole way. Easily one of the highlights of our trip to Zermatt.
Very beautiful but weather is risky until the last moment. I bought the tickets months in advance and was lucky to get some great views then also a snowstorm within one hour in end of may.

places.generalDescription: Matterhorn is a renowned alpine peak known for its distinctive pyramid shape and challenging climbing routes to the summit. It is part of the TORX program, featuring great trails in the Aosta Valley. Visitors can take a cable car to reach the terrace and enjoy stunning views of Matterhorn, Mont Blanc, Gran Paradiso, Monte Rosa, and Swiss peaks. The area also offers access to Plateau Rosa and Grotta di Ghiaccio on foot.

sources.snippet: I spent two days in Zermatt, a beautiful unique car-free village tucked away in the Swiss alps near the famous Matterhorn, and loved every minute of it. Zermatt is like the present you didn‚Äôt know you wanted until you got there and fell in love. It is such a cute village, especially in early September with bright flower pots all over the houses and restaurants making it all look so dreamy.
sources.shortName: Falling in love with the beautiful Swiss village of Zermatt

sources.snippet: Explore the car-free village, enjoy the day excursions to Gornegrat and Matterhorn Glacier Paradise, immerse yourself in breathtaking sightseeing, and uncover essential tips for an unforgettable trip. Learn from the mistakes I made* for a flawless trip. Let Zermatt weave its magic and create lasting memories in this captivating Swiss village.*
sources.shortName: Zermatt Travel Guide: From Hating to Falling in Love with the Majestic Matterhorn

sources.snippet: The mighty Matterhorn dominates the skyline, creating one of the most unique alpine landscapes in Europe. Explore the hiking trails, journey up higher into the mountains by cable car and train, stroll the scenic streets of Zermatt, and go skiing all year long. Here are the best things to do in Zermatt.
sources.shortName: 20 Amazing Things to Do in Zermatt, Switzerland

sources.snippet: With the beautiful changing colors of the sky and the magnificent Matterhorn in view, there will be pure love in the air. You can share a blanket to cuddle together or have a very romantic breakfast or dinner on this sunrise or sunset trips.
sources.shortName: Romance in

sources.snippet: The mountains are stunning at any time, but the Matterhorn tops them all for magnificent iconic views, and car free Zermatt is the ultimate picture-perfect ski resort.
sources.shortName: Should I go on honeymoon in Zermatt?

sources.snippet: Discover romance in Zermatt with a 2-hour guided tour, exploring historic sites and breathtaking views of the Matterhorn with your loved one.
sources.shortName: 2-hour romantic tour in Zermatt

places.name: Matterhorn

reviews.text: In my experience it was way better than Jungfrau. My family loved it. You can take the tram to the second to last stop and start walking down along the track for a beautiful view of the lake, the top of the mountain, the valley.

Nature is unbelievable. Matterhorn has around 430K of marked trails, everywhere you look is a beautiful nature. Valleys, glaciers, hills, fields, cows. Had an amazing hike and will be back hopefully sometime. Would love to Mountain bike here too, its just so beautiful and raw.

The Matterhorn is a must-see in Switzerland. Only after the trip did I realize how many different views of the Matterhorn I had captured. It truly is a mountain that draws your eye from every direction. Whether gazing up from the charming town of Zermatt or taking the train for a panoramic view from above, each perspective offered its own unique beauty. Some accommodations in Zermatt offer stunning views of this mountain, perfect for admiring it right from your window. We enjoyed seeing the Matterhorn in the morning, afternoon, and night, and the spectacular view looked breathtaking at every hour.

places.generalDescription: Riffelsee is a classic alpine lake located in a picturesque setting, renowned for its crystal-clear waters that beautifully reflect the iconic Matterhorn. This popular spot is easily accessible via the Gornergrat Bahn, a famous cog railway, making it a favored destination for many visitors. Situated at an altitude of 2757 meters, Riffelsee offers stunning photo opportunities of the Matterhorn without requiring extensive hiking. The 1.

sources.snippet: Hiking to the famous Riffelsee Lake during the summer in Zermatt is always recommended as one of the best things to do for couples in Zermatt. Although we haven‚Äôt personally got the chance to do it yet, it does look as though it would be a magical experience!
sources.shortName: Most Romantic Things to Do in Zermatt

sources.snippet: After spending half an hour at Lake Riffelsee, I boarded the next train to Gornergrat. It is one of those places everyone should visit at least once in a lifetime. The panoramic Swiss Alps and the glorious view of the Matterhorn are unforgettable from here.
sources.shortName: Zermatt Travel Guide: From Hating to Falling in Love with the Majestic Matterhorn

places.name: Riffelsee

reviews.text:
Really such a breathtaking and beautiful place ü•≤‚ù§Ô∏è. Was blessed with really good weather when I came, with clear blue skies and a perfect view of the Magnificent Matterhorn ü•∞ü•≤‚õ∞Ô∏è , and what more with the reflection of the Matterhorn across the lake ‚ù§Ô∏è.

Truly so pretty and perfect!! Feeling so happy and thankful everytime I look at my pics‚Ä¶. Tons of hikes to do at this area, what more can you ask for really! ü•∞üöÇ
It's not a very difficult walk. There are some stairs, but I think most people could manage. The view is very beautiful, the reflection is very clear, and it's not very crowded.

One cannot understate how incredible the view is here - and especially so with clearer skies.

It is well worth the early-morning journey to avoid the hoards of tourists who arrive closer to midday, etc.

places.generalDescription: Adler Hitta is a mountain restaurant located on Findeln, offering indoor seating and an outdoor terrace with stunning views of the Matterhorn. Skiers can easily access it from the Sunegga Express, while non-skiers have the option to hike from there. The restaurant is known for its specialty whole chicken and rotisserie dishes. While it may be considered less glamorous than some neighboring competitors, it offers a cozy mountain hut atmosphere and delicious food.

sources.snippet: Again, you are spoiled for choice when it comes to panoramic Cocktail terraces in Zermatt, but our personal favourite is Adler Hitta. It‚Äôs the perfect place to recharge together after a busy day of skiing or hiking.
sources.shortName: Most Romantic Things to Do in Zermatt

sources.snippet: On the list are Adler Hitta, Findlerhof, Enzian, and Chez Vrony, a Michelin-starred restaurant. You can choose one and have lunch or spend the afternoon hopping from one restaurant to the next.
sources.shortName: 20 Amazing Things to Do in Zermatt, Switzerland

places.name: Adler Hitta

reviews.text: It lived up to it's stellar reputation. We had a spectacular meal while basking in the sun and admiring the Matterhorn. A big thank you to the maitre d' for helping us tape together the remnants of my wife's ski boot.  4.9

Talk about having a great culinary experience on the slopes!

I had veal cheeks. My friends had the small chicken and the stroganoff chicken.

The veal cheeks were just amazing ü§©

We had a very nice lunch at Adler Hitta after doing the 5 lakes hike. We didn't have a reservation and were able to get in just fine. The food was excellent and it was fun to eat while looking at the gorgeous views. And they were kind enough to adapt a dish to make it vegetarian for me. Would recommend!

places.generalDescription: Nestled amidst towering peaks, 22 SUMMITS Boutique Hotel is a stylishly designed Alpine retreat in Zermatt. The hotel offers modern comforts and easy access to the town's attractions, ski slopes, and the Zermatt center. Guests can enjoy spacious rooms with large windows offering stunning views, along with amenities like a bar, spa, and free breakfast buffet. The hotel also provides concierge services, allergy-free rooms, and a terrace.

sources.snippet: Located in Zermatt and with Zermatt Railway Station reachable within 1.3 km, 22 Summits Boutique Hotel provides concierge services, allergy-free rooms, a terrace, free WiFi throughout the property and a bar. This 4-star hotel offers free shuttle service and a tour desk. Guests can use the spaand wellness centre with a fitness centre, sauna, and hot tub, as well as a shared lounge.
sources.shortName: My 20 most Romantic Hotels in Zermatt

sources.snippet: A chic mountain retreat in Zermatt offering 22 stylish Alpine rooms, many boasting balconies with Matterhorn views. Interiors blend natural wood and stone with a modern twist, creating a cosy yet contemporary vibe. Enjoy a tranquil spa, inviting lounge, and prime access to the town and cable car.
sources.shortName: Best places to stay in Zermatt, Switzerland (2025)

places.name: 22 Summits Boutique Hotel

reviews.text: Our stay at 22 Summit Apartments was nothing short of excellent. The owners and staff were incredibly warm and welcoming, and their hospitality truly stood out during an unexpected snowstorm that brought unprecedented snow levels. We were snowed in for a few days, but they went above and beyond-regularly checking in on us and helping to sort out transport when things finally cleared up. Their support made a potentially stressful situation feel safe and manageable. We couldn't have asked for better hosts and can't wait to come back! Truly wonderful place to stay.

We stayed in Zermatt after completing the Haute Route in April. We booked 22 Summits on Expedia not knowing the hotel. It was a nice surprise since the hotel had the most friendly staff, clean and modern rooms, and their spa facility was amazing. The family provided breakfast every morning with a nice array at the freshly prepared buffet. One thing that really stood out was the hospitality of the family (especially Rachel) and  their dedicated staff (Caroline in particular). We arrived just prior to a once in a lifetime storm that knocked out power and access to Zermatt for 72 hours. Everyone at the hotel went above and beyond to help accommodate their guests under extraordinary circumstances. The way they handled their guests with such a personalized service made us feel at home. I most certainly will return  to Zermatt and this would be the first hotel I would choose for my vacation. Thank you for the hospitality and making us feel like family during our stay. Hopefully next time there won't be a crazy storm so we are able to ski the mountains!

A true boutique hotel gem tucked away in Winkelmatten, near the gondola station and beautiful hiking trails - away from the Zermatt tourist crowds. It's a 10-minute walk to town or a 3-minute ride on the complimentary "green bus." We slept with the balcony door open to the soothing sound of a nearby mountain stream. Beautifully comfortable rooms and bathrooms with a tub and shower, a modern but cozy lobby and a relaxing spa / wellness area. A restaurant / dinner on site would be great (they have a pop up restaurant but only on certain days in the summer).

places.generalDescription: Gornergrat is a rocky ridge in Zermatt, accessible by a cog railway, and renowned for its stunning views of the Matterhorn and the Gorner Glacier. Visitors can opt for luxury hotels like Cervo Zermatt or unique stays at Riffelalp Resort 2222m or Igludorf. For activities, skiing on beautiful slopes and taking the panoramic train to Gornergrat are highly recommended.

sources.snippet: I didn‚Äôt put this in the hotel section because it‚Äôs more of a destination and it‚Äôs not easy to go back and forth into town if you want to go out to eat, drink or shop. The open air cog railway will get you all the way to the top, but if you‚Äôre short on time and already skiing, there is a chairlift where you can see the hotel and views on your way up.
sources.siteName: The Perennial Style | Dallas Fashion Blogger
sources.shortName: How To Plan A Honeymoon In Zermatt, Switzerland ‚Ä¢ Dallas Travel Blogger

sources.snippet: A mountain reaching 3,089 meters, Gornergrat offers an unforgettable experience. When you reach the top, you‚Äôll see 29 mountains that stand above 4,000 meters. Gornergrat can be reached with the highest cog railway in Europe, a trip of 9 kilometers lasting half an hour.
sources.shortName: 21 Best Attractions and Things to Do in Zermatt, Switzerland
20 Amazing Things to Do in Zermatt, Switzerland

places.name: Gornergrat

reviews.text:
Gornergrat Viewpoint (3,089m) üèîÔ∏è
‚Ä¢ Half-price with Swiss Travel Pass üéüÔ∏è
‚Ä¢ Train to watch landscapes shift from meadows to glaciers! üåø‚ùÑÔ∏è
‚Ä¢ Aletsch Glacier views + 360¬∞ snowy peaks-nature's masterpiece! ‚ú®

‚ö†Ô∏è Essentials:
‚òëÔ∏è Sunglasses (snow glare!) üï∂Ô∏è
‚òëÔ∏è Warm layers üß•üß§
‚òëÔ∏è Check weather before heading up üå¶Ô∏è

Great views. Trains do get crowded so be prepared to stand for most of the time.
Views are amazing.
Took the train to Gornergrat and hiked down to Riffelberg. Amazing views and experience. July, cool up top, shorts and long sleeves, hiked a couple hours including breaks for pictures and snacks.

places.generalDescription: Stellisee is a stunning mountain lake located near Zermatt in the Swiss Alps, known for its clear waters that beautifully reflect the iconic Matterhorn. Surrounded by alpine meadows and majestic peaks, it's a favorite spot for photographers and nature enthusiasts seeking the perfect shot of the mirrored peak. The glacial lake offers a tranquil setting and serves as an ideal location for nature photography.

sources.snippet: Whether you‚Äôre looking to brag about your recently-bought camera or a diehard romantic-looking view to impress your partner, Stellisee will undoubtedly satisfy your needs. It‚Äôs one of the most famous lakes in Zermatt and Switzerland, with its crystal clear water perfectly mirroring the mountain Matterhorn. Other than being a sight for sore eyes, the lake serves as a fantastic start to the day in the cool and clean air of the Alps.
sources.shortName: 21 Best Attractions and Things to Do in Zermatt, Switzerland

sources.snippet: The Five Lakes Hike is a moderately easy one that passes past five alpine lakes: Stellisee, Grindjisee, Gr√ºnsee, Moosjisee, and Leisee. The Matterhorn can be seen reflected in three lakes, and most of the walk provides undisturbed views of Switzerland‚Äôs most famous mountaintop.
sources.shortName: Zermatt Travel Guide: From Hating to Falling in Love with the Majestic Matterhorn
20 Amazing Things to Do in Zermatt, Switzerland

places.name: Stellisee

reviews.text:
I circled this lake as part of my mountain run.
There are no high vegetarian or any trees so you can clearly see the whole lake.
At the east corner there is a point where the Matterhorn is reflected nicely on the water so many people will take pictures there.
The lake is connected to 3 trails: one up to Fluhalp, second up to Blauherd and third down Grindjisee.
Effortless walk. But many big groups of tourists. So it's very crowded. There's some construction going on, but it didn't affect the overall experience too much.

If the weather was clear, then I don't have any lingering attachment about here. But ... at that moment, it was cloudy and sometimes rainy.
I couldn't realize that temperature, so I took a jacket just in case. However during the tracking, I was feeling hot.. so it was just stuff for carrying.

places.generalDescription: Air Zermatt offers a luxurious helicopter taxi service to Zermatt from various locations in Switzerland, providing an exclusive and expensive mode of transportation. Additionally, they specialize in emergency services such as rescues and medical transfers. For tourists, the company also provides breathtaking sightseeing flights around the Matterhorn and the Valais Alps. The heliport is conveniently located at the entrance of Zermatt and can accommodate cars.

sources.snippet: Air Zermatt provides a variety of sightseeing helicopter rides, and they are guaranteed to be one of the best things to do as a couple in Zermatt.
sources.shortName: Most Romantic Things to Do in Zermatt

places.name: Air Zermatt

reviews.text: Excellent experience from booking with Sonja to the flight with a very experienced and capable pilot. The weather was perfect, which helped, and the flight was super smooth. Thanks to all for an unforgettable experience!

I have planned many helicopter elopement wedding ceremonies, surprise proposals and champagne celebrations and heli-skiing with Air Zermatt. The pilots are always very friendly and helpful and professional. The views from the landing spots are epic.
reviews.author_name: Wild Souls United Elopements (Elopements in Switzerland)

reviews.text: An incredible experience not to miss in Zermatt and head on down when the weather and sky is good. Only thing is they only take reservation via phone and not email. We were lucky and managed to walk in to check and get a flight slightly an hour later which was great as we stayed about 10 minutes walk away. once on the helicopter, be prepared to be wowed by the view. family enjoyed the full 20mins!

places.generalDescription: The Matterhorn Museum - Zermatlantis, located in Zermatt, offers a unique insight into the history of the region and the mountaineers who conquered the Matterhorn. The museum documents the triumphs and tragedies surrounding the first ascent of the iconic peak in 1865. Visitors can explore a sunken village exhibit depicting different periods of time, complete with chalets, mazots, and dwellings.

sources.snippet: As a small village with a historical past, Zermatt has plenty to showcase at the Zermatlantis, the official name of the Matterhorn Museum. This museum exhibits the evolution of Zermatt from a modest mountain village into one of the largest centers of alpine resorts. It includes artifacts and equipment from the first ascent of the Matterhorn back in 1865 and remembers the lives lost during that time.
sources.shortName: 21 Best Attractions and Things to Do in Zermatt, Switzerland

sources.snippet: So, I decided to visit the Zermatlantis (Matterhorn Museum). Under the glass dome, next to the village church, a bygone era opened underground: Zermatlantis. It demonstrated how Zermatt evolved from a community of mountain farmers to the renowned ski resort we know today.
sources.shortName: Zermatt Travel Guide: From Hating to Falling in Love with the Majestic Matterhorn
20 Amazing Things to Do in Zermatt, Switzerland
2-hour romantic tour in Zermatt

places.name: Matterhorn Museum - Zermatlantis

reviews.text:
Matterhorn museum is a very good museum to learn about history and development of Matterhorn and Zermatt village. The entire journey of how a village of farmers got transformed into a major tourist attraction is exciting. You also learn about the mountaineers who lost their lives while climbing Matterhorn, the challenges faced by them, the lifestyle and history of Zermatt village and much more. The entire museum is underground and there are free lockers available to keep your luggage. As the museum opens in afternoon you can come here after your Gornergrat Matterhorn visit. It is close to¬† Zermatt station just a 10 minute walk. Matterhorn museum is free with Swiss Travel Pass.

Tip: The museum focuses more on history of Matterhorn and Zermatt. If you don't like history you might find this place boring.

Matterhorn Museum

After exploring the Matterhorn Views itself, with your Swiss Travel Pass you can visit this museum. It has a wide range of history about the city of Zermatt and how it became a touristic city in this age.

There's also a free locker that you can put your bags in before you explore inside the museum.

A lot of artifacts from the present and the past. I also like how the animals are involved in building the whole city knowing their contribution.

Besides skiing, the thing I was most excited for in Zermatt was the Matterhorn Museum. My husband and I visited while on our honeymoon and it was amazing. The museum truly transports you to the time when the town was being established. Seeing the rope from the first expedition of the Matterhorn was a remarkable experience. I stood in awe at the sight. I honestly could have spent over half a day in this museum and I'd love to go back and dedicate more time there. I highly recommend!

places.generalDescription: Restaurant Enzian Findeln, located near the bottom of the Findeln blue run and tucked behind a chapel, is now managed by Philippe Oswald. The menu has been completely overhauled to include Swiss specialties, upscale pasta dishes, and French offerings reflecting Philippe's origins. It's less known than its neighbor but offers last-minute table reservations even in high season.

sources.snippet: On the list are Adler Hitta, Findlerhof, Enzian, and Chez Vrony, a Michelin-starred restaurant. You can choose one and have lunch or spend the afternoon hopping from one restaurant to the next.
sources.shortName: 20 Amazing Things to Do in Zermatt, Switzerland

places.name: Mountain Restaurant Enzian

reviews.text: I would give this a 6 stars if it was possible! Food was great, service was warm and friendly, views were spectacular. Would highly recommend anyone reading this review to stop by for a meal

We had the best time at Enzian. The place is cozy, the service is great and the food is made with local ingredients and delicious. You cannot beat the views, especially on a sunny day. I would really recommend stopping by if you are doing the gourmet trail. We had the pork cheeks and the veal wurst and both things were really good. I would also recommend the house pate, which was delicious!

Excellent meal!!!!! We had lunch with  friends and ordered the lobster and pasta special- it was outstanding!!!!  Phillipe, our host, was amazing!!!! Such a great experience that we went back for lunch a second time. Simply GREAT food and service well beyond the better known, pretentious mountain restaurants.

places.generalDescription: Rothorn Bergstation offers one of the most breathtaking views in Zermatt, with a panorama that includes the Alps and the Matterhorn. Visitors can take a cable car to reach this vantage point and then enjoy activities such as hiking or skiing down to Zermatt. The Rothorn cafe provides an opportunity to relax and savor the stunning scenery while enjoying some food. While the cable car ticket may be pricey, many find it worthwhile for the incredible experience and views it offers.

sources.snippet: The lights can be seen from the village towards Schwarzsee, Trockner Steg and Rothorn. You can choose your favorite colors or whatever colors you think will help with your romantic evening!. With the beautiful lighting and the magnificent views of the village and the mountains, this will make your evening one of the unforgettably romantic night of your life.
sources.shortName: Romance in

places.name: Rothorn Bergstation

reviews.text: Just love it! Some of the best views in all Zermatt ski area. I love the slopes and the views. Stunning!
We probably haven't picked the top moment for perfect scenery around Rothorn but still enjoyed it. We found the bare rock landscape around the area, very unearthish.
Magnificent views of swiss alps! The cable car ride was just amazing.

places.generalDescription: Hennu Stall Apr√®s-Ski Bar is a popular spot located in the lower section of the Furi-Zermatt Valley run, accessible via Schwarzsee area or from Gornergrat via Riffelalp. From 2 PM to 7 PM, guests can dance and party to the tunes of DJs and live bands. It's known for its lively apr√®s-ski atmosphere and efficient service.

sources.snippet: Papperla Pub is a place where locals and visitors meet all year round, young and old, beer drinkers and champagne sippers. The party goes on until 2am with jagertee, mullet wine and solid food.
sources.shortName: Zermatt Top tables - Romantic lunch highest possible

places.name: Hennu Stall Apr√®s-Ski Bar

reviews.text: Best Apres spot ever!! Vibe is elite and this is clearly the place to go to enjoy music and have a drink after a long day skiing. DJ was always on point with the music and even though it gets crowded there's a lot of space to spread out.

A very fun apres-ski destination for Zermatt. Be warned that it is halfway down the piste and on an icy evening near the last run conditions can be quite treacherous to navigate down here on your skis - so make sure you know what you're doing! There is also one last downhill section after you leave, let that guide how many you drink!
Great spot, popping with music and good energy. Drink variety is good and prices are fair.

Great place to stop for drinks after a black ride
DJ the best
Friendly staff

places.generalDescription: Riffelberg is a picturesque spot in Zermatt that can be reached by taking the train from Murren. Visitors have the option to explore Gornergrat and hike to Riffelberg, with the flexibility of using the Gornergrat railway multiple times throughout the day. The area offers stunning views of Riffelsee Lake and access to gentle skiing options above Riffelberg.

sources.snippet: After first part of the meal it‚Äôs time for the main course at Riffelberg. Hiking downhill will take you one hour, but the train is a more romantic option. At famous Riffelberg non-fish lovers can enjoy lamb and excellent beef of venison for second plate.
sources.shortName: Zermatt Top tables - Romantic lunch highest possible

sources.snippet: On the way back to Zermatt, you will ride the cable car to Riffelberg and then the Gornergrat railway to get to Gornergrat.
sources.shortName: Zermatt Travel Guide: From Hating to Falling in Love with the Majestic Matterhorn

places.name: Riffelberg

reviews.text: Just spectacular!! Great drinks, comfortable seating, plenty to do during a snowboarding / skiing pit stop
We stopped here to walk to the lake and look over the matterhorn, it's good. Unfortunately pretty cloudy on that day. Otherwise would have been a good spot.
Stopped by riffelberg on our way back to zermatt from gornegrat. This whole area has been amazing

places.generalDescription: Zermatt Ski Resort is a renowned destination, known for its fabulous skiing, breathtaking scenery, and a wide range of high-quality dining and accommodation options. The town has a rich history dating back to the Middle Ages and has maintained its traditional charm. Situated in the German-speaking part of Valais Canton in Southern Switzerland, this car-free resort offers reliable snow conditions and stunning views of the Matterhorn. With 360km of ski slopes, it is one of the largest ski resorts in Europe.

sources.snippet: Since it was our first time skiing in Zermatt we opted to have a guide take us out so we could take the guesswork out of where we should go and just follow the pro. Kevin‚Äôs family recommended Stokedski since that who they have always used and they did not steer us wrong. Adam, who has been a ski guide in Zermatt for over 15 years was incredibly knowledgeable about the mountain and was able to tailor the day to our liking.
sources.siteName: The Perennial Style | Dallas Fashion Blogger
sources.shortName: How To Plan A Honeymoon In Zermatt, Switzerland ‚Ä¢ Dallas Travel Blogger

places.name: Zermatt Ski Resort

reviews.text: Really enjoyed skiing here, even as a beginner. I would say that you could probably enjoy it much more as at least an intermediate skier, but the views were incredible and the infrastructure is so well made.
It is good ski resort. Slopes are very good, lifts are new and one of the most modern i europe.  I'll say it is very very good. But.... is it worth? I think that not really. Prices are very high.

They call it a skiers paradise and I totally agree. The train, gondolas & chairlifts are incredible and efficient. Slopes are marked extremely well making it easy to navigate and you can even ski into Italy, just make sure you purchase an international ski pass. As for the views, well they are nothing short of spectacular.

places.generalDescription: Located in the heart of Zermatt, Papperla Pub is a popular apres-ski destination that attracts a lively crowd. Situated near the church and Hotel Julen, this bustling Irish-style pub offers an exciting atmosphere managed by energetic bar staff. From 5pm to 7pm, the place gets packed with skiers enjoying post-slope revelry and warm bar snacks. As night falls, live bands take the stage inside, adding to the vibrant ambiance.

sources.snippet: Papperla Pub is a place where locals and visitors meet all year round, young and old, beer drinkers and champagne sippers. The party goes on until 2am with jagertee, mullet wine and solid food. The igloos at Iglu-Dorf on Rotenboden at 2500 m above sea level is created from glistering snow and reconstructed every year, and designed by international artists.
sources.shortName: Zermatt Top tables - Romantic lunch highest possible
Falling in love with the beautiful Swiss village of Zermatt

places.name: Papperla Pub

reviews.text: Great pub with pleasant and smiling service, excellent live music with a famous singer and fantastic Guinness beer on tap. Highly recommended.
Delicious chicken wings!! Maybe the best ones I ever had haha. Cant wait to try more food in the future. Excellent atmosphere and service. Very friendly server!!

this location is one of the reasons, why we love it so much in zermatt!! what a great staff, the atmosphere is fantastic and the live music knocks you out! we had such an awesome time, the last 20 years. thank you so much!!!! üíãüíãüíãüíã

places.generalDescription: Swiss Chalet is a cozy restaurant located in the heart of Zermatt, offering a wide variety of delicious Swiss fondues such as Moitie-Moitie, Porcini, Tomato, Truffel, Fondue Bourguignonne, Chinoise, Surf & Turf and their signature Fondue Swiss Chalet with fillet of beef. The authentic atmosphere of the chalet brings a mountain spirit to your dining experience.

sources.snippet: If we had to choose, though, we‚Äôd recommend the Swiss Cheese Fondue at the Swiss Chalet Restaurant close to the Bahnhofstrasse in the centre of Zermatt town.
sources.shortName: Most Romantic Things to Do in Zermatt

places.name: Swiss Chalet

reviews.text:
Great atmosphere for a traditional Swiss restaurant.
Fondue and traditional foods. The cordon bleu was fantastic.
Do not skip the dessert.  Those apple donut things were amazing, I'm stealing those for my next dinner party.

Very cozy cabin like atmosphere.  We went for fondue and were a bit naive- believing that all fondue was cheese related- and ended up with the meat fondue with broth.  Zero complaints though- it was DELICIOUS.  If I could find a bottle of their garlic sauce I would die happy. Though, All the sauces and flavors were truly great.  Our waitress was so sweet and spoke more languages than google.  We really enjoyed ourselves and if we had stayed longer we would have returned for the cheese fondue.  Best to make a reservation as they were busy- Was very easy to do the reservation online.  Only recommendation would be to read the menu very well-  or end up with a happy cheese free accident like us!

The most beautiful and classic Swiss restaurant i have ever been and Ana and Maria were professional, courteous, pleasant, and caring! Had huge surprise for my wife's birthday by the awesome staff! The foods were fresh, tasty, carefully prepared with burst of flavors coming out from the fresh and tasty ingredients! Thank y'all so much for the thoughtfulness and a great time!

places.generalDescription: Trockener Steg is a 9,642-ft. mountain in Zermatt, Switzerland, offering skiing and a cable car ride. It also features a discovery center with a VR experience. The area has several lift stations including the Sunnegga lift station restaurant, Trockener Steg, and Riffelberg. Visitors can enjoy basic lunches at relatively modest prices at these stations.

sources.shortName: Zermatt Top tables - Romantic lunch highest possible

places.name: Trockener Steg

reviews.text: Great place for skiing, been there in May, buying ski tickets in advance in that time period is something that I cannot recommend , because of weather that is changing quite fast and because of that ski lifts do not operate quite often. It is safer to buy tickets on the day of skiing.
The Matterhorn feels like so close from here, nice view on the sunny day

There for hikers: you get the best view of the divine Matterhorn all along your semi challenging journey from Trockener Steg to Schwarsee. Absolutely stunning and good level of work out. Attention however that you will need proper hiking shoes to avoid slippery snow-covered path.

places.generalDescription: Pfarrkirche St. Mauritius, situated in the heart of Zermatt, Switzerland, is a captivating historical and cultural site. This 19th-century church showcases traditional Alpine architecture and exudes a tranquil ambiance for visitors to immerse themselves in. The stone architecture and charming altars add to its allure, offering a glimpse into the past. With its clock tower reaching towards the sky, reminiscent of the iconic Matterhorn, this church holds services in multiple languages on select Sundays.

sources.shortName: 2-hour romantic tour in Zermatt

places.name: Pfarrkirche St. Mauritius

reviews.text: The church was a pretty new building, in comparison to other churches in Europe region. It has amazing architecture for such a small village, but if you read in history, it was first mention in the 1200.
Nice Church in Zermat. Recently built it looks like.

St. Mauritius is the main Parish Church in downtown Zermatt. It's around 100 years old.
We found the Church exterior more appealing than interiors, specially with great Matterhorn views. At the Church backside is a small cemetery with buried mountaineers who died during Matterhorn conquest.
Interiors are pretty modest with the Noah's Ark painting on the ceiling. We were lucky being there when a local school class had their lecture by the altar which was a very memorable experience

places.generalDescription: Rotenboden offers a variety of activities for visitors, making it an ideal destination for both skiers and non-skiers. Accessible via the Gornergrat train from Riffelberg, Rotenboden is home to the famous Riffelsee, which provides stunning photography opportunities as it begins to thaw in late spring. For those looking for alternative winter activities, there are prepared snow trails for leisurely walks and long sled runs exceeding 1 km in length.

sources.snippet: The igloos at Iglu-Dorf on Rotenboden at 2500 m above sea level is created from glistering snow and reconstructed every year, and designed by international artists. Visit during the day and enjoy Swiss cheese fondue and breathtaking view.
sources.shortName: Zermatt Top tables - Romantic lunch highest possible

places.name: Rotenboden

reviews.text: this is the stop to get off if you want to see Matterhorn's reflect on lake Riffelsee. My suggestion is to get off at this stop when you are coming back down. The lake is a short walk from the station. It is off trail though. If the condition is windy then you might not be able to see the reflection.
Remembering the place where my friend almost lost his life
Love..love..love...nice view..

places.generalDescription: Blue Lounge is a must-visit spot in Zermatt, offering stunning views and a cozy atmosphere. Whether you're skiing or simply taking the gondola up the mountain, this car-free destination is perfect for enjoying delicious Swiss food, drinks, and live music. The spacious terrace provides an ideal setting to savor light snacks while admiring the Matterhorn. With comfortable lounge furniture and a warm fireplace, it's easy to lose track of time at Blue Lounge.

sources.snippet: We stopped here for a drink when we were skiing and I could have stayed all day!. The views were stunning, the music was great, and they had comfortable lounge furniture that you can really sink into for the day!. It‚Äôs almost at the top of the mountain, but I learned there is a gondola nearby so once again, if you don‚Äôt ski, you can still come up here for a drink and meet up with your friends that may be out on the mountain ‚Äì or if you have too much fun, you can take the gondola down.
sources.siteName: The Perennial Style | Dallas Fashion Blogger
sources.shortName: How To Plan A Honeymoon In Zermatt, Switzerland ‚Ä¢ Dallas Travel Blogger

places.name: Blue Lounge

reviews.text: This is my now *fianc√©* and I's second trip to Zermatt and we could not wait to go back to blue lounge our favorite place. The atmosphere, service, food at Blue lounge is unbeatable. The perfect stop on the Sunnegga side of the mountain for some mid day drinks, food and music. We were so excited to visit Miqueas who worked at blue lounge last year. The staff always takes care of us and makes us feel like family. Thank you for helping to make my engagement the most special day! We will miss Blue Lounge.

A really awesome spot for some spectacular views - just make sure you're there when the weather is good to fully appreciate the views! The staff are friendly and helpful. If it gets busy, the service does get a little slow. Make sure you arrive before the lunch time rush!
Have some coffee and take a rest here for a nice view of panorama view of mountains, especially Mayterhorn!

places.generalDescription: Gee's is a small boutique vegan restaurant in Zermatt that offers a variety of vegan options. The Superfood Salad, featuring quinoa, avocado, olives, feta cheese, nuts, seeds, fruit and mixed salad leaves with honey and mustard dressing is highly recommended. The restaurant has a nice atmosphere and decor with great use of space. The service is friendly and efficient. In addition to the delicious sushi offerings, the homemade ginger beer is also worth trying.

sources.snippet: This restaurant and bar is in the heart of Zermatt and is always popping. We went here two nights in a row because we had so much fun sitting at the bar, talking to our new favorite bartender Nicki, and listening to the music, all while having some delicious sushi!. Gee‚Äôs has a sushi restaurant downstairs but we loved being in the action at the bar!
sources.siteName: The Perennial Style | Dallas Fashion Blogger
sources.shortName: How To Plan A Honeymoon In Zermatt, Switzerland ‚Ä¢ Dallas Travel Blogger

places.name: Gee's

reviews.text: After having a heavy fondue the night before, the lighter Asian fare hit the spot. Atmosphere and decor were nice. Great use to space. Service was good and friendly. The fried shrimp gyoza, crab cakes and dragon roll were delicious. We also loved the hot shrimp rolls and the spicy tuna rolls. It was great to get a coke (on ICE and lots of it). The open wontons were just okay and so was the Japanese fried rice. It was lunch so we didn't get a chance to order and cocktails. There was a very good selection of cocktails, wine & beer. Also saw signs for nightly live music.

Delishous sushi and super service! Their home made ginger beer is great! Upstairs in the bar the food is great too, if you like live music that's a great place to eat! Downstairs is more cozy and quiet, we love the dining both up and down, not as much sushi in the bar though, but lots of other delishous asian dishes. Very friendly service there aswell.

We had a very tasty dinner at this place. Fresh food and fast service. The staff was was very friendly and the chef even explained us where the fish comes from. Prices are high like everywhere in Zermatt/Switzerland.
